body_html:
I have the same problem:
if issparse is not None and issparse(ins[i]) and not K.is_sparse(feed[i]):
IndexError: list index out of range

This is with 1.12.0-dev20180929

It should be solved in this nightly build right?

In my code a tensor a passed to model.fit. The Tensor is a concatenation of multiple batches from different datasets:

data = list(map(lambda x: x.make_one_shot_iterator().get_next(), classes))
batch = tf.concat(axis=0, values=data)
model.fit(
batch,
steps_per_epoch=100,
epochs=params['num_epochs'])

body:
I have the same problem:
if issparse is not None and issparse(ins[i]) and not K.is_sparse(feed[i]):
IndexError: list index out of range

This is with 1.12.0-dev20180929

It should be solved in this nightly build right?

In my code a tensor a passed to model.fit. The Tensor is a concatenation of multiple batches from different datasets:

data = list(map(lambda x: x.make_one_shot_iterator().get_next(), classes))
batch = tf.concat(axis=0, values=data)
model.fit(
        batch,
        steps_per_epoch=100,
        epochs=params['num_epochs'])
